test_patch:
diff --git a/test/sql/types/timestamp/test_timestamp_types.test b/test/sql/types/timestamp/test_timestamp_types.test
index 93327c7c4371..9cc79da0419e 100644
--- a/test/sql/types/timestamp/test_timestamp_types.test
+++ b/test/sql/types/timestamp/test_timestamp_types.test
@@ -65,27 +65,19 @@ select milli::TIME from timestamp;
 statement error
 select nano::TIME from timestamp;
 
-# Some timestamp direct conversions are not yet supported
-statement error
-select sec::TIMESTAMP_MS from timestamp;
-
-statement error
-select sec::TIMESTAMP_NS from timestamp;
-
+# Direct timestamp promotions
+foreach src sec milli micro nano
 
-statement error
-select milli::TIMESTAMP_SEC from timestamp;
-
-
-statement error
-select milli::TIMESTAMP_NS from timestamp;
+foreach dst sec milli micro nano
 
+statement ok
+SELECT ${src}, ${dst} 
+FROM timestamp 
+WHERE ${src} = ${dst} ;
 
-statement error
-select nano::TIMESTAMP_SEC from timestamp;
+endloop
 
-statement error
-select nano::TIMESTAMP_MS from timestamp;
+endloop
 
 #Sorting on the timestamps
 query T
@@ -195,23 +187,33 @@ select '2008-01-01 00:00:11.1'::TIMESTAMP_US = '2008-01-01 00:00:11.1'::TIMESTAM
 ----
 false
 
-# Missing casts
-statement error
+# Precision casts
+query I
 select '2008-01-01 00:00:11.1'::TIMESTAMP_MS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_NS
+----
+false
 
-
-statement error
+query I
 select '2008-01-01 00:00:11.1'::TIMESTAMP_MS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_S
+----
+false
 
-
-statement error
+query I
 select '2008-01-01 00:00:11.1'::TIMESTAMP_NS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_S
+----
+false
 
-statement error
+query I
 select '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_MS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_NS
+----
+true
 
-statement error
+query I
 select '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_MS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_S
+----
+true
 
-statement error
-select '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_NS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_S
\ No newline at end of file
+query I
+select '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_NS = '2008-01-01 00:00:11'::TIMESTAMP_S
+----
+true
problem_statement:
Unimplemented type for cast (TIMESTAMP_S -> TIMESTAMP_MS)
### What happens?

Cannot compare timestamp values with different precisions.

### To Reproduce

v0.8.1 6536a77232
Enter ".help" for usage hints.
Connected to a transient in-memory database.
Use ".open FILENAME" to reopen on a persistent database.
D CREATE TABLE EXAMPLE (TS TIMESTAMP_S, TMS TIMESTAMP_MS);
D INSERT INTO EXAMPLE VALUES('2019-10-10 15:30:05', '2019-10-10 15:30:05.123') ;
D SELECT * FROM EXAMPLE WHERE TS = TMS;
Error: Conversion Error: Unimplemented type for cast (TIMESTAMP_S -> TIMESTAMP_MS)


### OS:

Linux

### DuckDB Version:

v0.8.1

### DuckDB Client:

cli

### Full Name:

Leonid Chistov

### Affiliation:

Querify Labs

### Have you tried this on the latest `main` branch?

I have tested with a main build

### Have you tried the steps to reproduce? Do they include all relevant data and configuration? Does the issue you report still appear there?

- [X] Yes, I have
hints_text:
Workaround:
cast them both to `TIMESTAMP`

```sql
SELECT * FROM EXAMPLE WHERE TS::TIMESTAMP = TMS::TIMESTAMP
```
